title: Apparent Fake Cobb T-206 sold on eBay for $25K
author: TRC4191

posts.post_title: Apparent Fake Cobb T-206 sold on eBay for $25K

posts.post_content:
[quote name="TRC4191" post=2463895]Interesting article: 

[url]https://www.hobbynewsdaily.com/post/t206-ty-cobb-in-a-fake-gai-slab-sold-for-25k-on-ebay-anyone-care[/url][/QUOTE]


A major red flag just in general is that card not being sold through a major auction house.  Most people would go that route rather than eBay.

But looks like it turned out to be real so buyer got lucky for sure.

I believe it crossed to a PSA 5.5 

[url]https://youtu.be/lD5cNOJYoJo?si=zFm-MwI-5GxzCVT6[/url]

[quote name="Neal" post=2463907]I believe it crossed to a PSA 5.5 

[url]https://youtu.be/lD5cNOJYoJo?si=zFm-MwI-5GxzCVT6[/url][/QUOTE]

Crazy story.  Buyer got really lucky!
I was just about to post that it looks fine to me.  Glad the buyer didn't get ripped off.
It was obviously a real card just from the Gai slab photo. The real question was, was it trimmed? And psa thinks not.
An it's a Factory 42 Piedmont as well!

Cool video, Neal, thanks.

I am guessing the buyer is the same Jamie on Net54 who owned that amazing red portrait Cobb back run?

Funny story, I literally just received two T206s a couple days ago in the exact GAI slabs they are talking about. The slab just pops right open. I’m a newer collector so I’m nowhere close to being an expert but as far as I can tell (and smell) the cards are real and I’m not real sure why someone would try and fake a $50 t206 common so I guess I’m just confused as to why someone would go through all of the trouble to put a real card in a fake slab. Maybe to portray it as a higher grade than what it really is? But again, these cards are commons that I bought for $50 each so I’m just not understanding I guess. 


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
